item.description:
Bullwinkle Weekend On Pristine Lake Aziscohos

A SPECIAL INVITATION from member Aleksandra Featuring a Sunday hike to Mt. Magalloway with a spectacular view of Mts Washington, Sugarloaf, Kennebago and others, and the Connecticut lakes headwaters in fall splendor

Come relax and share stories around the campfire listening to an evening symphony of loon tremulos and hoots.



You are invited to meet at the black brook cove campground. Get detailed directions here (http://blackbrookcove...) .
The meeting location is off rt 16 between Errol, ME and Rangelely, ME for an escort 13 miles deep into the western mountains of Maine to a lakefront cabin:

Saturday is for Resting and Relaxing with beach, boats, boards, bikes, bait, bullmoose and loons.



Departing Sunday morning at 10am for an easy hike up Mt Magalloway, winding down at nearby and onto Hellsgate and Garfield Falls for a picnic and departures home. Download the map of the hike, map 2.4 here)
(http://www.nhparks.st...



Gear list: Binoculars, hiking gear.sunblock, swimsuit, towel, optional mountain bike, Maine fishing license available at the Cove campground, beverages, veggies/ protein or marshmallows for grilling. Bugs should be done for the season, and brave swimmers would be advised to pack earplugs to limit earaches.

My camp provides coffee/tea, lighting, fishing tackle and bait, refrigeration and cooking appliances for meals, and limited bed space on a half acre. There is space for about 4 tents outside. I have a fishing boat for anyone interested in a boat tour of the 14 mile waters in the front yard.

Because of the distance into camp, I will meet inbound campers at the Blackbrook Cove campground at 10pm Friday evening and again Saturday (noon?). For drivers of cars with sufficient ground clearance, I can provide instructions to navigate the road on an individual basis.

If you want to join the hike only we will meet at the Parmacheenee road on rt 16 at 10:30 am on Sunday morning. There is excellent parking area .3 miles in for people who want to head home straight from the trail on Sunday.



Mt. Magalloway summit is at 3360 feet and requires only a short hour hike. (http://www.firelookou...) It has a maintained fire tower which can be scaled to near top, even when the ranger is out. GreyJays are plentiful and will pluck apple cores from platform. Garfield Falls is a historic logging legacy and the stony scape is breathtaking and inviting. In spring flood it must be deafening and fierce. Another nearby falls could be added as the group wishes, called Hellgate Falls. In the logging days loggers where lowered on ropes to cut up logjams, or to place dynamite. Many loggers died in the attempt and the name seems therefore appropriate.
item.name: Bullwinkle Weekend On Pristine Lake Aziscohos
